---
title: "Code Gallery"
---

This page lists CoastWatch code gallery tutorials.  
Click the **eye** icon to view the tutorial or **download** to get the source file.

```{python}
import pandas as pd
from IPython.display import HTML

# CHANGE THESE IF YOU RENAME THE REPO
REPO_RAW_BASE = "https://github.com/madrichardson/CoastWatch-Training-Tutorials/raw/main/"

df = pd.read_csv("code_gallery.csv").fillna("")

def view_icon(path, label):
    if not path:
        return '<span class="text-muted">—</span>'
    return (
        f'<a href="{path}" aria-label="{label}">'
        f'<i class="bi bi-eye-fill"></i></a>'
    )

def download_icon(repo_path, label):
    if not repo_path:
        return '<span class="text-muted">—</span>'
    return (
        f'<a href="{REPO_RAW_BASE}{repo_path}" aria-label="{label}">'
        f'<i class="bi bi-download"></i></a>'
    )

rows = []
for _, r in df.iterrows():
    rows.append({
        "Title": r["title"],
        "Category": r["category"],
        "Python": view_icon(r["py_view"], f"View Python: {r['title']}"),
        "Python ↓": download_icon(r["py_download"], f"Download Python: {r['title']}"),
        "R": view_icon(r["r_view"], f"View R: {r['title']}"),
        "R ↓": download_icon(r["r_download"], f"Download R: {r['title']}"),
    })

out = pd.DataFrame(rows)

HTML(
    out.to_html(
        index=False,
        escape=False,
        classes=["code-gallery-table"]
    )
)
```
